title: Protection of life and personal liberty.
text: No person shall be deprived of his life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law.
summary:
• Maneka Gandhi, 1978:
    • SC held that the procedure prescribed by law has to be 'fair, just and reasonable, not fanciful, oppressive or arbitrary'.
    • Thus, Art 21 was interpreted to incld substantive fairness, echoing the essence of the American ‘due process’ clause, found in both 5th & 14th Amend.s of US Const
    • This marked a judicial shift from the AK Gopalan Case 1950
    • MG 1978 also recognised that an inter-relationship exists b.w Art 14, 19, 21
